page.title: 15Petworth Helps Ethiopians
page.content: Each sack was marked "Petworth Ethiopia Relief Supplies SIM Aid". S.I.M. stands for Sudan Interior Mission. The two lorries were loaded by a yellow fork_lift truck. We found out that there are 12 feeding stations in the Humbo region of Wolayata where the grain is going. The grain will travel from Petworth on lorry to Goole,Humberside and then ship to Ethiopia. The farmers who helped were Mr.Riddell, Mr.Waterman, Mr.Gadd, Lord Egremont and Mr.Tupper. We did it because we saw the awful television pictures of the famine in Ethiopia,and decided that we needed to do something about it.
